help.title: Usage Instructions
help.featuresDesc: This tool is used to visualize disk space usage, displaying file size distribution using treemap visualization.
help.step1Desc: Enter the disk path to scan (e.g., C:\ or D:\projects) in the input box, or select a drive from the dropdown menu.
help.step2Desc: Click the "Start Scan" button, and the program will recursively scan all files and folders under the specified path.
help.step3Desc: After scanning is complete, the interface will display a treemap, where each rectangle represents a file or folder, with area proportional to size.
help.step4a: Hover over rectangles to view detailed information
help.step4b: Click rectangles to open the corresponding file/folder location in Explorer
help.sizeDesc: Represents file/folder space usage, larger means more usage
help.colorDesc: Represents hierarchy depth, up to 3 levels of nesting can be displayed
help.borderDesc: Indicates whether it is a folder (thick border for folders)
help.note1: Scanning large disks may take a long time, please be patient
help.note2: Some system folders may be inaccessible and will be automatically skipped
help.note3: It is recommended to run with administrator privileges to get complete scan results
help.shortcutEnterDesc: Press Enter in the path input box to start scanning
